title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 24 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 24 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 24 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 24.

questions.question: How old was Joash when he began to reign?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven years old
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:1 states that Joash was seven years old when he began to reign.

questions.question: Who was Joash's mother?
questions.correctAnswer: Zibiah of Beersheba
questions.explanation: The text in 2 Chronicles 24:1 identifies Joash's mother as Zibiah of Beersheba.

questions.question: What kind of actions did Joash do all the days of Jehoiada the priest?
options: That which was right in the sight of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: That which was right in the sight of the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:2 says Joash did that which was right in the sight of the LORD all the days of Jehoiada.

questions.question: What did Joash decide to repair?
questions.correctAnswer: The house of the LORD
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 24:4, Joash was minded to repair the house of the LORD.

questions.question: Who did Joash gather to collect money for repairs?
questions.correctAnswer: Priests and Levites
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:5 states that Joash gathered the priests and Levites to collect money for repairs.

questions.question: What was made at the king's command to collect the money?
questions.correctAnswer: A chest
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:8 explains that at the king’s command, a chest was made and set at the gate of the house of the LORD.

questions.question: Where was the chest set to collect money?
options: At the gate of the house of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: At the gate of the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 24:8 specifies the chest was placed at the gate of the house of the LORD.

questions.question: What did the king and Jehoiada do with the money collected?
options: Gave it to workers and hired craftsmen to repair the house of the LORD
Used it for the king's palace
Sent it to a neighboring kingdom
Stored it in the treasury without spending
questions.correctAnswer: Gave it to workers and hired craftsmen to repair the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:12 states that the king and Jehoiada gave the money to those who worked to repair the house of the LORD.

questions.question: How old was Jehoiada when he died?
options: One hundred and thirty years old
questions.correctAnswer: One hundred and thirty years old
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:15 records Jehoiada’s age at death as 130 years old.

questions.question: Where was Jehoiada buried?
options: In the city of David among the kings
questions.correctAnswer: In the city of David among the kings
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 24:16, Jehoiada was buried in the city of David among the kings because of his good deeds.

questions.question: True or False: After Jehoiada died, the princes of Judah led the king to serve groves and idols.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:17-18 explain that after Jehoiada's death, the princes led the king to forsake the LORD and serve groves and idols.

questions.question: True or False: The Spirit of God came upon Zechariah son of Jehoiada to warn the people after Joash's reign turned away from God.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:20 shows that the Spirit of God came upon Zechariah son of Jehoiada to speak to the people.

questions.question: True or False: Joash remembered Jehoiada’s kindness and protected his son Zechariah.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:22 states that Joash did not remember Jehoiada’s kindness and instead ordered the death of his son Zechariah.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 2 Chronicles 24:21: 'And they conspired against him, and ______ him with stones at the commandment of the king.'
questions.correctAnswer: stoned
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:21 states that Zechariah was stoned with stones at the king’s command.

questions.question: Who conspired against Joash and killed him?
options: Zabad son of Shimeath and Jehozabad son of Shimrith
questions.correctAnswer: Zabad son of Shimeath and Jehozabad son of Shimrith
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:26 names Zabad and Jehozabad as those who conspired against Joash and killed him.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 24 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 24 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 24 teach us about stewardship and generosity in church life?
options: Giving regularly to support the work of God's house
Keeping money for personal use instead of church needs
Only giving when asked by the priest
Ignoring the repair needs of the church building
questions.correctAnswer: Giving regularly to support the work of God's house
questions.explanation: Joash commanded the people to gather money yearly to repair the house of the LORD (2 Chronicles 24:4-5, 24:9-12). This teaches us to be faithful and generous stewards in supporting God's work.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with perseverance in doing good works. Based on 2 Chronicles 24, what biblical truth would you share?
options: Hastening in obedience leads to successful completion of God’s work
Good works are unnecessary if others do not participate
Waiting passively is the best approach
God does not care about physical repairs
questions.correctAnswer: Hastening in obedience leads to successful completion of God’s work
questions.explanation: Though the Levites delayed, the king encouraged diligence and the work was completed successfully (2 Chronicles 24:5-6, 24:12-13). This shows the blessing in actively persisting in good deeds.

questions.question: What does the life of Jehoiada in 2 Chronicles 24 teach about faithfulness in service to God?
options: Faithful service leads to honor and blessing
Service is rewarded only in worldly terms
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful service leads to honor and blessing
questions.explanation: Jehoiada served faithfully until his old age and was honored by being buried among kings (2 Chronicles 24:15-16). This teaches the value of lifelong devotion to God’s work.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 24 warn about the consequences of abandoning God’s commandments?
options: Forsaking God leads to judgment and defeat
Ignoring God has no real consequences
Consequences only come from other nations
questions.correctAnswer: Forsaking God leads to judgment and defeat
questions.explanation: After Jehoiada died, the people turned to idols and God allowed the Syrians to defeat them as judgment (2 Chronicles 24:18, 24:23-24). This shows the seriousness of disobedience.

questions.question: What biblical principle about leadership and influence can we learn from Joash’s reign in 2 Chronicles 24?
options: Leaders should heed godly counsel to remain righteous
Leaders can ignore advisors without consequence
Power is independent of God’s guidance
Leadership is only about military strength
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders should heed godly counsel to remain righteous
questions.explanation: Joash did right while Jehoiada guided him, but after Jehoiada's death, he turned away from God and faced consequences (2 Chronicles 24:2, 17-18, 22). This teaches the importance of godly counsel.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to compromise their faith under pressure. According to 2 Chronicles 24, what truth encourages steadfastness?
options: God’s Spirit empowers us to resist and speak truth
Ignoring sin will make it disappear
questions.correctAnswer: God’s Spirit empowers us to resist and speak truth
questions.explanation: Zechariah, filled with the Spirit of God, boldly confronted the people’s disobedience despite opposition (2 Chronicles 24:20-21). This encourages believers to rely on God’s Spirit for courage.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 24 exemplify the importance of honesty and integrity in handling resources?
options: Leaders were responsible for faithfully managing the money and reporting daily
Leaders could use the funds for personal gain
The money was hidden and never counted
The collection was not important for repairs
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders were responsible for faithfully managing the money and reporting daily
questions.explanation: The king’s scribe and high priest’s officer emptied and counted the collection daily and gave it to workers (2 Chronicles 24:11-12). This shows the value of integrity in stewardship.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 24, Joash honored Jehoiada’s legacy by continuing to follow God's commands after Jehoiada’s death.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: After Jehoiada died, Joash abandoned the LORD and served idols, forgetting Jehoiada’s kindness (2 Chronicles 24:17-18, 22).

questions.question: True or False: The chapter shows that family relationships, such as between Joash and Jehoiada, can influence spiritual growth and obedience.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Joash did right while Jehoiada, his priestly mentor, was alive and guiding him (2 Chronicles 24:2), showing the positive impact of godly family and mentorship.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 24 instruct us about the importance of spiritual discipline and continual worship?
options: Burnt offerings were offered continually during Jehoiada's lifetime
Worship was only occasional and not necessary
Offerings could be replaced by idols
Only priests were responsible for worship
questions.correctAnswer: Burnt offerings were offered continually during Jehoiada's lifetime
questions.explanation: The chapter states burnt offerings were continually made in the house of the LORD all the days of Jehoiada (2 Chronicles 24:14), emphasizing consistent devotion and worship.

questions.question: A church community is struggling with unity in carrying out God’s work. Based on 2 Chronicles 24, what practical advice would you give?
options: Leaders should clearly communicate God’s commands and encourage participation
Only some should work; others can be passive
Funds should not be collected for repairs
Delay in service is acceptable without consequence
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders should clearly communicate God’s commands and encourage participation
questions.explanation: Joash gathered priests and Levites and commanded them to collect funds and hasten the repair work, showing leadership in mobilizing the community (2 Chronicles 24:5-6, 9-10).

questions.question: What lesson about humility and gratitude can be drawn from the end of Joash's life in 2 Chronicles 24?
options: Failure to remember kindness and to repent leads to downfall
One’s end is unrelated to their faithfulness
questions.correctAnswer: Failure to remember kindness and to repent leads to downfall
questions.explanation: Joash forgot Jehoiada’s kindness and killed his son, leading to conspiracy and a dishonored death (2 Chronicles 24:22, 25-26). This warns against pride and ungratefulness.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Joash was _____ years old when he began to reign, and he reigned _____ years in Jerusalem.
questions.correctAnswer: seven; forty
questions.explanation: The chapter clearly states Joash was seven years old when he began to reign and reigned forty years (2 Chronicles 24:1).

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 24 instruct us about the importance of spiritual accountability and confronting sin?
options: God sends prophets to call people back to obedience
Sin should be ignored to maintain peace
Accountability is unnecessary in the church
questions.correctAnswer: God sends prophets to call people back to obedience
questions.explanation: The chapter mentions that prophets were sent to call Judah back to the LORD, but they did not listen (2 Chronicles 24:19). This shows the importance of accountability.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 24, what is the role of family and parenting in spiritual growth?
options: Jehoiada took care to marry Joash and had sons and daughters, showing family nurturing
Family has no role in spiritual development
questions.correctAnswer: Jehoiada took care to marry Joash and had sons and daughters, showing family nurturing
questions.explanation: Jehoiada took two wives for Joash and begat children (2 Chronicles 24:3), which demonstrates God’s design for family and parenting in spiritual nurture.

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 24 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 24.

questions.question: At what age did Joash begin to reign over Jerusalem according to 2 Chronicles 24?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven years old
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:1 states that Joash was seven years old when he began to reign.

questions.question: Who was the priest that influenced Joash to do what was right in the sight of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Jehoiada
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 24:2, Joash did what was right in the sight of the LORD all the days of Jehoiada the priest.

questions.question: What was the initial purpose behind Joash’s gathering of priests and Levites to collect money?
options: To repair the house of the LORD
To pay tribute to foreign kings
questions.correctAnswer: To repair the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:4-5 explains that Joash intended to repair the house of the LORD and instructed priests and Levites to gather money for this purpose.

questions.question: What reason does 2 Chronicles 24 give for the Levites' initial failure to hasten the money collection?
options: They were afraid of the king
They were busy with other duties
questions.correctAnswer: They were negligent
questions.explanation: Verse 5 says that the Levites did not hasten the matter, implying negligence in carrying out the king’s command.

questions.question: What historical wrongdoing is mentioned as having caused damage to the house of God before Joash's reign?
options: The sons of Athaliah had broken up the house of God and dedicated things to Baalim
Foreign armies had destroyed the temple
A great fire had consumed the house of God
The priests had stolen the temple treasures
questions.correctAnswer: The sons of Athaliah had broken up the house of God and dedicated things to Baalim
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:7 explains that the sons of Athaliah broke up the house of God and bestowed dedicated things upon Baalim.

questions.question: What method did Joash implement to ensure funds for the repair of the house of the LORD?
options: A chest was made and set at the gate of the house of the LORD
A tax was imposed on all citizens
questions.correctAnswer: A chest was made and set at the gate of the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: Verse 8 details that a chest was made and placed at the gate of the house of the LORD to collect money.

questions.question: What was the response of the princes and people when the collection for the house of the LORD was proclaimed?
options: They rejoiced and brought in money until the collection was complete
They only gave small amounts reluctantly
questions.correctAnswer: They rejoiced and brought in money until the collection was complete
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:10 states all the princes and people rejoiced and brought money until they finished the collection.

questions.question: Who were responsible for emptying the chest and safeguarding the collected money?
options: The king’s scribe and the high priest’s officer
questions.correctAnswer: The king’s scribe and the high priest’s officer
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 24:11, the king’s scribe and the high priest’s officer emptied the chest daily and carried the money to its place.

questions.question: What types of workers did the king and Jehoiada hire to repair the house of the LORD?
options: Masons, carpenters, and workers in iron and brass
questions.correctAnswer: Masons, carpenters, and workers in iron and brass
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:12 indicates that masons, carpenters, and workers in iron and brass were hired to repair the temple.

questions.question: How long did Jehoiada live according to this chapter, and what significance does this have?
options: 130 years old, signifying a long and blessed life
70 years old, the age of strength
questions.correctAnswer: 130 years old, signifying a long and blessed life
questions.explanation: Verse 15 records Jehoiada's age as 130 years, highlighting his exceptional longevity and favor.

questions.question: What happened to Judah and Jerusalem after Joash hearkened to the princes and abandoned the LORD?
options: Wrath came upon them for their trespass
questions.correctAnswer: Wrath came upon them for their trespass
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:18 states that wrath came upon Judah and Jerusalem because they left the LORD and served idols.

questions.question: Which prophet, son of Jehoiada, was struck down at the command of King Joash?
questions.correctAnswer: Zechariah
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 24:20-21, Zechariah son of Jehoiada was stoned at the king’s command.

questions.question: What was the consequence of Joash forsaking the LORD God of his fathers, as described in this chapter?
options: The LORD delivered a great host into the hand of the Syrians
He was blessed with peace and prosperity
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD delivered a great host into the hand of the Syrians
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:24 explains that the LORD handed Joash’s enemies a great host because he forsook God.

questions.question: How did Joash's reign end according to 2 Chronicles 24?
options: He was killed by his own servants in conspiracy
He died peacefully of old age
He was exiled to a foreign land
questions.correctAnswer: He was killed by his own servants in conspiracy
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:25 states that Joash was slain by his own servants in conspiracy.

questions.question: True or False: The chapter shows a typology of Joash’s reign where obedience leads to restoration, but disobedience leads to judgment and death.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The narrative arc in 2 Chronicles 24 reflects this typology, with Joash’s early obedience under Jehoiada leading to temple restoration, and later disobedience resulting in judgment (verses 2-13, 18-25).

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 24 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 24 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: At what age did Joash begin to reign as king, and how long did he reign according to 2 Chronicles 24?
options: Seven years old and reigned forty years
Twelve years old and reigned twenty years
Fifteen years old and reigned thirty years
Ten years old and reigned twenty-five years
questions.correctAnswer: Seven years old and reigned forty years
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:1 states explicitly that Joash was seven years old when he began to reign and reigned forty years. This demonstrates God's sovereign choice in appointing young leaders, similar to David's anointing as a youth (1 Samuel 16:12-13).

questions.question: How did Joash conduct himself in the sight of the LORD during the days of Jehoiada the priest?
options: He did right in the sight of the LORD
He was indifferent to God's commands
questions.correctAnswer: He did right in the sight of the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:2 notes Joash did what was right in the sight of the LORD during Jehoiada's lifetime, reflecting the importance of godly mentorship (Proverbs 22:6, 2 Timothy 1:5). This faithfulness is also consistent with God's commendation of righteous kings like Hezekiah (2 Kings 18:3).

questions.question: What initiative did Joash undertake concerning the house of the LORD?
options: He planned to repair the house of the LORD
He sought to destroy the house of the LORD
He ignored the house of the LORD
He sold the house of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: He planned to repair the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 24:4, Joash was minded to repair the house of the LORD, demonstrating reverence for God's dwelling place, consistent with the biblical emphasis on the temple as God's presence among His people (1 Kings 8:27-30, Psalm 84:1-4).

questions.question: What was the response of the Levites when Joash commanded them to gather money for the repair of the temple?
options: They hastened not to do it
questions.correctAnswer: They hastened not to do it
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:5 reveals the Levites did not hasten the collection as commanded, showing human failure even among God's servants, which parallels Israel's repeated neglect of covenant duties (Nehemiah 13:10-12).

questions.question: Why did Joash question Jehoiada about the Levites' failure to collect funds?
options: Because the commandment of Moses prescribed such a collection
Because Jehoiada wanted to keep the money
Because the Levites were enemies of the king
Because the people refused to give
questions.correctAnswer: Because the commandment of Moses prescribed such a collection
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:6 emphasizes that Joash reminded Jehoiada of Moses' commandment regarding the collection for the tabernacle of witness, underscoring the necessity of obedience to God's law (Exodus 30:11-16, Numbers 18:21-24).

questions.question: What had the sons of the wicked woman Athaliah done to the house of God?
options: Broken it up and bestowed dedicated things upon Baalim
questions.correctAnswer: Broken it up and bestowed dedicated things upon Baalim
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:7 states that the sons of Athaliah desecrated the house of God and gave sacred things to Baalim, highlighting apostasy and idolatry, a recurring theme of Israel's unfaithfulness (Judges 2:11-13, Hosea 2:8).

questions.question: What was created at the king's command to aid in the collection for the temple repairs?
options: A chest set at the gate of the house of the LORD
A private fund managed by the priests
questions.correctAnswer: A chest set at the gate of the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:8 records that a chest was made and placed at the temple gate to collect offerings, reflecting organized worship and stewardship (Exodus 38:8, Mark 12:41-44).

questions.question: How did the princes and people of Judah respond to the proclamation to bring money for the repair of the temple?
options: They rejoiced and brought money until the collection was complete
questions.correctAnswer: They rejoiced and brought money until the collection was complete
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:10 shows the joyful and generous response of the people, illustrating the biblical principle of cheerful giving (2 Corinthians 9:7, Exodus 35:21).

questions.question: What role did the king and Jehoiada play with the money collected for the temple repairs?
options: They gave it to workers and craftsmen to repair the house of the LORD
They sent it to foreign kings
They used it to build palaces
questions.correctAnswer: They gave it to workers and craftsmen to repair the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:12 explains that the king and Jehoiada administered the funds responsibly for temple repair, exemplifying faithful stewardship, akin to Nehemiah's rebuilding efforts (Nehemiah 2:17-18).

questions.question: What was done with the leftover money after the temple repairs were completed?
options: Made vessels for the house of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Made vessels for the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:14 relates that surplus funds were used to create temple vessels, ensuring ongoing worship, consistent with Exodus 25-27 instructions on holy utensils supporting sacrificial worship.

questions.question: How old was Jehoiada when he died, and how was he honored?
options: One hundred and thirty years old; buried among the kings for his goodness
Eighty years old; buried in a common grave
Ninety years old; honored in the temple
One hundred years old; forgotten by the people
questions.correctAnswer: One hundred and thirty years old; buried among the kings for his goodness
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:15-16 states Jehoiada died at 130 years and was buried with kings due to his faithfulness, showing God's reward for godly leadership (Hebrews 11:4-7).

questions.question: What spiritual decline occurred after Jehoiada’s death?
options: The people left the LORD and served groves and idols
The nation was at peace without sin
questions.correctAnswer: The people left the LORD and served groves and idols
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:18 describes apostasy after Jehoiada's death, illustrating the vulnerability of God's people without godly leadership (Judges 2:10-19, Hosea 4:6).

questions.question: Who was Zechariah and what happened to him according to this chapter?
options: Son of Jehoiada, a prophet stoned at the king's command
A foreign king who attacked Judah
A Levite who led temple repairs
questions.correctAnswer: Son of Jehoiada, a prophet stoned at the king's command
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:20-21 recounts that Zechariah, filled with the Spirit, rebuked the people and was stoned by royal command, illustrating rejection of true prophecy (Acts 7:52, Matthew 23:37).

questions.question: What divine principle is illustrated by Joash's fate after he forsook the LORD?
options: Judgment comes upon those who forsake the LORD
God rewards all kings regardless of faith
Ignoring God's commands has no consequences
questions.correctAnswer: Judgment comes upon those who forsake the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:23-24 shows that Joash faced defeat and judgment because he forsook God, consistent with biblical teaching on sin's consequences (Deuteronomy 28:15-68, Romans 1:18-32).

questions.question: How did Joash die, and where was he buried?
options: Killed by his servants and buried in the city of David, but not among the kings
Died peacefully and buried among the kings
Exiled and buried in a foreign land
Killed in battle and buried on the battlefield
questions.correctAnswer: Killed by his servants and buried in the city of David, but not among the kings
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 24:25 records Joash was assassinated by his servants and buried in the city of David but not in the royal tombs, indicating disgrace due to his unfaithfulness (Psalm 118:18).
